sen.j: 皇室（こうしつ）は天皇および皇族の総称。
sen.e: The Imperial Family is a generic term for the Emperor and the members of the Imperial Family.
The Imperial Family is a generic term for the Emperor and the members of the Imperial Family.
The Imperial Family is a generic term for the Emperor and the members of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 戦前においては、帝室（ていしつ）とも呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Before World War II, it was called in Japanese Teishitsu rather than Koshitsu as currently used.
sen.cmt: 日本語の問題なので原文どおりの英訳は無意味。よって現在は皇室と呼ばれるという説明を追加。
sen.e: Before World War II, it was called in Japanese Teishitsu rather than Koshitsu as currently used.
Before World War II, it was called in Japanese Teishitsu rather than Koshitsu as currently used.

sen.j: 天皇と内廷皇族を家族とする内廷と皇太子以外の男性皇族及びその家族である宮家で構成される。
sen.e: It includes both the Inner Court which consists of a family of the Emperor and inner-court members of the Imperial Family, and the princely houses, each of which comprises a prince other than the Crown Prince and his family.
sen.cmt: 内廷皇族 Inner-court members of the Imperial Family（宮内庁HPによる）
sen.e: It includes both the Inner Court which consists of a family of the Emperor and inner-court members of the Imperial Family, and the princely houses, each of which comprises a prince other than the Crown Prince and his family.

It includes both the Inner Court which consists of a family of the Emperor and inner-court members of the Imperial Family, and the princely houses, each of which comprises a prince other than the Crown Prince and his family.

sen.j: 具体的には天皇を中心にその配偶者である皇后、先代の天皇の未亡人である皇太后、先々代の天皇の未亡人である太皇太后を含む。
sen.e: More specifically, it is composed of the Emperor, his consort, the Empress, the widowed consort of the previous Emperor, the Empress Dowager, and the widowed consort of the Emperor before the previous one, the Grand Empress Dowager.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: More specifically, it is composed of the Emperor, his consort, the Empress, the widowed consort of the previous Emperor, the Empress Dowager, and the widowed consort of the Emperor before the previous one, the Grand Empress Dowager.

More specifically, it is composed of the Emperor, his consort, the Empress, the widowed consort of the previous Emperor, the Empress Dowager, and the widowed consort of the Emperor before the previous one, the Grand Empress Dowager.

sen.j: また皇太子をはじめとした男性皇族である親王、王 (皇族)も含まれる。
sen.e: It also includes the Crown Prince, princes who are the male children of an Emperor by his consort and other princes who are male members of the Family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 宮内庁では親王、王の英語名称はいずれもprince。ここでは「親王＝天皇の嫡子」「王＝その他の男性皇族」の説明を追加して区別。 なお、どちらも男性皇族と規定されているので、Imperial PrinceとPrinceの訳し分けは意味をなさない。 *正式名称に従い区別しない場合は以下の通り。It also includes the males imperial members, the Crown Prince and other princes.
sen.e: It also includes the Crown Prince, princes who are the male children of an Emperor by his consort and other princes who are male members of the Family.
It also includes the Crown Prince, princes who are the male children of an Emperor by his consort and other princes (imperial family) who are male members of the Family.

sen.j: さらには生まれながらの女性皇族である内親王、女王 (皇族)がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, it comprises princesses who are the female children of an emperor by his consort and other princesses born into the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処宮内庁では内親王、王女の英語名称はいずれもprincess。ここでは「内親王＝天皇の嫡子」「王女＝その他の女性皇族」の説明を追加して区別。 なお、どちらも女性皇族と規定されているので、Imperial PrincessとPrincessの訳し分けは意味をなさない。*正式名称に従い区別しない場合。Furthermore, it comprises the female imperial members, the princesses born into the Family.
sen.e: Furthermore, it comprises princesses who are the female children of an emperor by his consort and other princesses born into the Imperial Family.
Furthermore, it comprises princesses who are the female children of an emperor by his consort and other princesses (imperial family) born into the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 親王妃、王妃 (皇族)は親王、王の配偶者となることをもって、皇族とされる。
sen.e: The spouses of the princes become princesses as imperial members upon marriage.
The spouses of the princes become princesses as imperial members upon marriage.
The spouses of the princes become princesses (imperial family) as Imperial Family members upon marriage.

tit.e: The Structure of the Imperial Family

sen.j: 天皇は皇居内に御所を構える。
sen.e: The Emperor resides in the Imperial Residence on the grounds of the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 宮内庁には同庁の内部部局として宮内庁侍従職が天皇・皇后とその未婚の子女に関する事務を扱う機関として置かれている。
sen.e: The Board of the Chamberlains is an internal division of The Imperial Household Agency, administering the affairs of the Imperial Couple and their unmarried children.

tit.j: 日本国外の王室との相違点
tit.e: Differences between the Imperial Family and Foreign Royal Families
Differences between the Imperial Family and Foreign Royal Families
Differences between the Imperial Family and foreign royal families
tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 日本の皇室は現在の日本国につながる国家が始まって以来ずっと続いている。
sen.e: The Japanese Imperial Family has a continuous line of succession since the rise of a state leading to modern Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Japanese Imperial Family has a continuous line of succession since the rise of a state leading to modern Japan.
The Japanese Imperial Family has a continuous line of succession since the rise of a state leading to modern Japan.

sen.j: 従って、たとえば中国の唐などの歴代の王朝や、現存する日本国外のウィンザー朝（イギリス）、チャクリー王朝（タイ王国）のような「国内に存在した他の王朝と区別するための王朝の名前」を持たない。
sen.e: It therefore does not require any dynastic designation, "which serves to distinguish it from the other dynasties that existed in the country" like, for example, the successive dynasties in China such as the Tang Dynasty, the House of Windsor (in Great Britain), or the Chakri Dynasty (in the Kingdom of Thailand).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It therefore does not require any dynastic designation, "which serves to distinguish it from the other dynasties that existed in the country" like, for example, the successive dynasties in China such as the Tang Dynasty, the House of Windsor (in Great Britain), or the Chakri Dynasty (in the Kingdom of Thailand).

It therefore does not require any dynastic designation, 'which serves to distinguish it from the other dynasties that existed in the country' like, for example, the successive dynasties in China such as the Tang Dynasty, or the existing House of Windsor (Great Britain) and the Chakri Dynasty (Kingdom of Thailand).

sen.j: 強いて言えば、「日本」という国名そのものが王朝名である。
sen.e: Its dynastic designation, if one can venture to say, is "Japan," the name of the country itself.
Its dynastic designation, if one can venture to say, is "Japan," the name of the country itself.
Its dynastic designation, if one can venture to say, is 'Japan,' the name of the country itself.

sen.j: また、天皇、皇族は氏（名字）を持たないが、これは日本人の氏は本来、天皇が臣下に与えるものであったからである。
sen.e: The Emperor and Imperial Family members have no surnames, which were originally given by emperors to their subordinates.
The Emperor and Imperial Family members have no surnames, which were originally given by emperors to their subordinates.
The Emperor and Imperial Family members have no surnames, which were originally given by emperors to their subordinates.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 現在の皇室の活動は激務である。
sen.e: The contemporary Imperial Family are engaged in many activities.
The contemporary Imperial Family is engaged in many activities.
The contemporary Imperial Family is engaged in many activities.

sen.j: 天皇が行幸等する場合は国外であっても三種の神器八尺瓊勾玉を携帯する。
sen.e: The Emperor carries the jewel Yasakami no Magatama, one of the imperial regalia of Japan whenever he travels both within and without Japan.
The Emperor carries the jewel Yasakami no Magatama, one of the imperial regalia of Japan whenever he travels both within and without Japan.
The Emperor carries Yasakami no Magatama, which is one of the three sacred imperial treasures, whenever he travels both within and without Japan.
sen.cmt: 三種の神器 を追加しました。

sen.j: 終戦直後は昭和天皇による地方巡幸が行われた。
sen.e: Immediately after the War, Emperor Showa made an imperial tour throughout the country.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Immediately after the War, Emperor Showa made an imperial tour throughout the country.
Immediately after the War, Emperor Showa made an imperial tour throughout the country.

sen.j: だが、この様な大規模な巡幸はあまり行われることはない。
sen.e: However, such a grand tour has seldom been made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, such a grand tour has seldom been made.
However, such a grand tour has seldom been made.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 国事行為
sen.e: State Affairs
State Affairs
State affairs
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 日本国憲法第6条と日本国憲法第7条により、天皇がおこなう。
sen.e: According to Articles 6 and 7 of the Constitution of Japan, the Emperor must administer state affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to Articles 6 and 7 of the Constitution of Japan, the Emperor must administer state affairs.
According to Articles 6 and 7 of the Constitution of Japan, the Emperor must administer state affairs.

sen.j: だが、皇族に対してのみ摂政、もしくは国事行為臨時代行をおき、代行させることができる。
sen.e: He can however appoint a regent from the Imperial Family or a temporary replacement who undertakes state affairs for him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He can however appoint a regent from the Imperial Family or a temporary replacement who undertakes state affairs for him.
He can however appoint a regent from the Imperial Family or a temporary replacement who undertakes state affairs for him.

sen.j: 新年祝賀、親任式、認証官任命式、勲章親授式、信任状捧呈式の儀式として行われる。
sen.e: The state affairs include the Ceremonies of New Year Reception, Imperial Investiture, Appointment of Officials with Imperial Attestation, Imperial Conferment of Decoration, and Presentation of Credentials.

The state affairs include the Ceremonies of New Year Reception, Imperial Investiture, Appointment of Officials with Imperial Attestation, Imperial Conferment of Decoration, and Presentation of Credentials.

The state affairs include the Ceremonies of New Year Reception, Imperial Investiture, Appointment of Officials with Imperial Attestation, Imperial Conferment of Decoration, and Presentation of Credentials.

sen.j: 一般参賀
sen.e: People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting
People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting
People's visit to the Palace
sen.cmt: 新年 を削除しました。

sen.j: 新年祝賀と天皇誕生日祝賀に際し、皇居において一般参賀をおこなう。
sen.e: On New Year Celebration and the Emperor's Birthday, the public can visit the Palace to offer their congratulations.
On New Year Celebration and the Emperor's Birthday, the public can visit the Palace to offer their congratulations.
On New Year Celebration and the Emperor's Birthday, the public can visit the Palace to offer their congratulations.

sen.j: 天皇と皇族が皇居長和殿のベランダに出て（「お出まし」）、祝賀を受ける。
sen.e: The Emperor and imperial members appear on the balcony of the Chowaden Hall of the Palace ("the imperial advent") to receive the public's congratulations.
The Emperor and imperial members appear on the balcony of the Chowaden Hall of the Palace ("the imperial advent") to receive the public's congratulations.
The Emperor and Imperial Family members appear on the balcony of the Chowaden Hall of the Palace ('the imperial advent') to receive the public's congratulations.

sen.j: なお三権の長を招いて行う「新年祝賀の儀」は国事行為に該当する儀式だが、この「新年一般参賀」は国事行為以外の公務とされている。
sen.e: While "The Ceremony of New Year Reception," held in the presence of the heads of the three branches of the government is a state affair, "People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting" is regarded as one of the imperial public activates other than the state affairs.

While "The Ceremony of New Year Reception," held in the presence of the heads of the three branches of the government is a state affair, "People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting" is regarded as one of the imperial public activities other than the state affairs.

While 'The Ceremony of New Year Reception,' held in the presence of the heads of the three branches of the government is a state affair, 'People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting' is regarded as one of the imperial public activities other than the state affairs.

sen.j: 園遊会
sen.e: Garden Parties
Garden Parties
Garden parties
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 天皇・皇后主催の社交の会。
sen.e: Garden Parties are social gatherings hosted by the Emperor and Empress.
Garden Parties are social gatherings hosted by the Emperor and Empress.
Garden parties are social gatherings hosted by the Emperor and Empress.

sen.j: 毎年、春と秋の2回、赤坂御苑において催される。
sen.e: They are held at the Akasaka Imperial Gardens twice every year, in spring and autumn.
They are held at the Akasaka Imperial Gardens twice every year, in spring and autumn.
They are held at the Akasaka Imperial Gardens twice every year, in spring and autumn.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 五穀豊穣や国家国民の安寧を祈るものである。
sen.e: Imperial court rituals are performed for the purpose of good harvests and national / public peace.
Imperial court rituals are performed for the purpose of good harvests and national / public peace.
Imperial court rituals are performed for the purpose of good harvests and national / public peace.

sen.j: 代表的なものは主に現在の祝祭日（春分の日の春季皇霊祭など）にあたる日に行われている。
sen.e: Important rituals are conducted on current national holidays (e.g. the Spring Commemoration for the Imperial Spirits on the Spring Equinox Day).
Important rituals are conducted on current national holidays (e.g. the Spring Commemoration for the Imperial Spirits on the Spring Equinox Day).
Important rituals are conducted on current national holidays (e.g. the Spring Commemoration for the Imperial Spirits on the Spring Equinox Day).

tit.e: Imperial Visit by the Emperor or Imperial Members
tit.cmt: 行啓＝天皇以外の皇族の訪問
tit.e: Imperial Visit by the Emperor or Imperial Members
Imperial visit by the Emperor or imperial members
tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 急遽、戦災（東京大空襲）や被災した地域に行幸することがしばしばある。
sen.e: Emperors often made impromptu tours of areas damaged by the War (the Great Tokyo Air Raids) or disaster.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Emperors often made impromptu tours of areas damaged by the War (the Great Tokyo Air Raids) or disaster.
Emperors often made impromptu tours of areas damaged by the War (the Great Tokyo Air Raids) or disaster.

sen.j: それ以外は一般にかねてより計画されたものとなる。
sen.e: otherwise imperial visits are usually scheduled in advance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: otherwise imperial visits are usually scheduled in advance.
Otherwise imperial visits are usually scheduled in advance.
sen.cmt: 大文字から始めました。

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 各国の王室との関係は親密である。
sen.e: The Imperial Family has close relationships with foreign royal families.
The Imperial Family has close relationships with foreign royal families.
The Imperial Family has close relationships with foreign royal families.

sen.j: 取り決めによってそれぞれの王室に不幸があった場合、半旗を掲げることと、服喪することが慣例になっている。
sen.e: Following a convention, it customarily lowers the flag to half-staff and observes mourning when a member of a royal family passes away.
Following a convention, it customarily lowers the flag to half-staff and observes mourning when a member of a royal family passes away.
Following a convention, it customarily lowers the flag to half-staff and observes mourning when a member of a royal family passes away.

sen.j: 天皇の国事行為の「外国の外交官の接受」の一環である「信任状奉呈式」に際しては、皇室の馬車での送迎を認めている。
sen.e: On the occasion of the "Ceremony of Presentation of Credentials" as part of the "Reception of Foreign Diplomats," which is counted among the state affairs, a newly-appointed ambassador is offered the service of a horse-drawn carriage for transportation.

On the occasion of the "Ceremony of Presentation of Credentials" as part of the "Reception of Foreign Diplomats," which is counted among the state affairs, a newly-appointed ambassador is offered the service of a horse-drawn carriage for transportation.

On the occasion of the 'Ceremony of Presentation of Credentials' as part of the 'Reception of Foreign Diplomats,' which is counted among the state affairs, a newly-appointed ambassador is offered the service of a horse-drawn carriage for transportation.

sen.j: 馬車を使用した場合、東京駅（東京駅改装中に付、現在は明治生命本店前）から皇居宮殿御車寄までの道のりになる。
sen.e: When an ambassador prefers a carriage, he rides from the Tokyo Station (at the time of writing, in front of the Meiji Life Insurance Headquarters as the station is under refurbishment) up to the carriage way of the Main Palace on the grounds of the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: 明治生命本店は旧称。現在は明治生命館 Meiji Life Insurance Building
sen.e: When an ambassador prefers a carriage, he rides from Tokyo Station (at the time of writing, in front of the Meiji Life Insurance Headquarters as the station is under refurbishment) up to the carriage way of the Main Palace on the grounds of the Imperial Palace.

When an ambassador prefers a carriage, he rides from Tokyo Station (at the time of writing, in front of the Meiji Life Insurance Headquarters as the station is under refurbishment) up to the carriage way of the Main Palace on the grounds of the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 自動車での送迎も可能であるが馬車を希望する大使が多いと言われる。
sen.e: Many ambassadors apparently prefer a carriage to a limousine, which is also offered.
Many ambassadors apparently prefer a carriage to a limousine, which is also offered.
Many ambassadors apparently prefer a carriage to a limousine, which is also offered.

sen.j: 皇室の馬車による送迎は各国親善に役立っているという（宮内庁ホームページ）。
sen.e: The carriage service has contributed to the nurturing of friendly relations with countries (according to the website of the Imperial Household Agency).
The carriage service has contributed to the nurturing of friendly relations with countries (according to the website of the Imperial Household Agency).
The carriage service has contributed to the nurturing of friendly relations with countries (according to the website of the Imperial Household Agency).

sen.j: 2007年8月、馬インフルエンザの影響により馬車による送迎が見送られた事がある。
sen.e: In August 2007 it was cancelled due to equine influenza.
In August 2007 it was cancelled due to equine influenza.
In August 2007 it was cancelled due to equine influenza.

tit.e: The Imperial Relation with the Public
The Imperial Relationship with the Public
tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。
小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 明治天皇及び過去の天皇の巡行にならい、昭和天皇以降も全国への「巡幸」が行われている。
sen.e: Following the examples of Emperor Meiji's and other past emperors, the Emperor continues to make "imperial visits" to all parts of Japan like Emperor Showa.
Following the examples of Emperor Meiji and other past emperors, the Emperor continues to make "imperial visits" to all parts of Japan like Emperor Showa did.
Following the examples of Emperor Meiji and other past emperors, the Emperor continues to make 'imperial visits' to all parts of Japan like Emperor Showa did.

sen.j: 明治以降の皇室及び過去の皇室の伝統にならい、皇室による社会福祉や教育など社会的な活動として、「ご公務」が行われる。
sen.e: Observing the tradition of the imperial families in the past, especially after the Meiji period, the current Family are engaged in social activities in welfare, education and the like as their "public activities."

Observing the tradition of the imperial families in the past, especially after the Meiji period, the current Family is engaged in social activities in welfare, education and the like as "public activities."

Observing the tradition of the imperial families in the past, especially after the Meiji period, the current Family is engaged in social activities in welfare, education and the like as 'public activities.'

sen.j: 主に式典の主賓としての列席及び祝辞、弔辞、開会または閉会の「お言葉」として挨拶をするなどが代表的な活動といえる。
sen.e: Typically, as guests of honors, they attend ceremonies and often make "addresses" to the audiences: congratulations, condolences, or inaugural or concluding speeches.
Typically, as guests of honors, they attend ceremonies and often "address" audiences: congratulations, condolences, or inaugural or concluding speeches.
Typically, as guests of honors, they attend ceremonies and often 'address' audiences: congratulations, condolences, or inaugural or concluding speeches.

sen.j: 更に、医療・社会福祉施設・児童施設への訪問や戦没者などへの慰霊碑などへの参拝も積極的に行われている。
sen.e: They are also dedicated to visiting medical, social welfare or juvenile facilities as well as war memorials.
They are also dedicated to visiting medical, social welfare or juvenile facilities as well as war memorials.
They are also dedicated to visiting medical, social welfare or juvenile facilities as well as war memorials.

tit.e: People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting
People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting
tit.cmt: 新年 を削除しました。

sen.j: 新年の一般参賀は正月に皇居において天皇はじめ皇族が7回、長和殿に「お出まし」として姿を現し、国民の参賀を受ける。
sen.e: On the day of People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting, the Emperor and Imperial Family members make "special appearances" on the balcony of the Chowa Palace seven times to receive the public's New Year greetings.
sen.cmt: 上記135にならい、「（長和殿の）ベランダ」を追加しました。
sen.e: On the day of People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting, the Emperor and Imperial Family members make "special appearances" on the balcony of the Chowa Palace seven times to receive the public's New Year greetings.

On the day of People's Visit to the Palace for the New Year Greeting, the Emperor and Imperial Family members make 'special appearances' on the balcony of the Chowaden Hall of the Palace seven times to receive the public's New Year greetings.

sen.j: 又、天皇誕生日にも同様、一般参賀が行われる（2008年度は過去最高の2万2655人が参賀：宮内庁発表）。
sen.e: Likewise on the Emperor's Birthday the Emperor and Imperial Family members receive the public's congratulations at the Palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Likewise on the Emperor's Birthday the Emperor and Imperial Family members receive the public's congratulations at the Palace.

Likewise on the Emperor's Birthday the Emperor and Imperial Family members receive the public's congratulations at the Palace (in the fiscal 2008 a record high of 22,655 people visited the Palace according to the Imperial Household Agency).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動しました。Fiscal を追加しました。

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 皇室の行事の一つで新年を賀するために宮中で行われる和歌の会。
sen.e: A New Year poetry reading is a poetry gathering to celebrate the New Year, held by the Palace as part of the imperial public activities.
A New Year poetry reading is a poetry gathering to celebrate the New Year, held by the Palace as part of the imperial public activities.
A New Year poetry reading is a poetry gathering to celebrate the New Year, held by the Palace as part of the imperial public activities.

sen.j: 一定の題にしたがって国民からの詠進歌を募集している（詳しくは歌会始を参照のこと）。
sen.e: The public can send their verses on specified themes to the Palace (for more information see the page on New Year Poetry Reading).
The public can send their verses on specified themes to the Palace (for more information see the page on New Year Poetry Reading).
The public can send their verses on specified themes to the Palace (for more information see the page on New Year Poetry Reading).

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 宮内庁では、国民の自主的な意思に基づく奉仕による皇居の清掃活動への参加を受け付けている。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Agency allows the public to voluntarily participate in cleaning the Palace.
The Imperial Household Agency allows the public to voluntarily participate in cleaning the Palace.
The Imperial Household Agency allows the public to voluntarily participate in cleaning the Palace.

sen.j: 主に希望者は複数名からなる団体として申し込みをし、清掃活動を行うことができる。
sen.e: To clean the Palace, those who wish to offer their voluntary services must form a group, which then applies for a volunteer opportunity to the Agency.
To clean the Palace, those who wish to offer their voluntary services must form a group, which then applies for a volunteer opportunity to the Agency.
To clean the Palace, those who wish to offer their voluntary services must form a group, which then applies for a volunteer opportunity to the Agency.

sen.j: 多数応募がある場合は抽選となる。
sen.e: Volunteer groups will be decided by lot if many apply.
Volunteer groups will be decided by lot if many apply.
Volunteer groups will be decided by lot if many apply.

sen.j: 主な内容は除草、清掃、庭園作業などである。
sen.e: Their main tasks include weeding, cleaning and gardening.
Their main tasks include weeding, cleaning and gardening.
Their main tasks include weeding, cleaning and gardening.

sen.j: 毎年、学校関係の団体、地域の婦人会など多くの申し込みがある。
sen.e: Every year, many school organizations, women's groups in the neighborhood and other groups apply for volunteer work.
Every year, many school organizations, women's groups in the neighborhood and other groups apply for volunteer work.
Every year, many school organizations, women's groups in the neighborhood and other groups apply for volunteer work.

sen.j: 1945年の敗戦直後に有志「皇国（みくに）奉仕団」が皇居の荒れ様に心を痛めて始めたのが興りといわれる。
sen.e: This practice reportedly goes back to a group of volunteers, "Mikuni Hoshidan" (Volunteers for Imperial Japan) who were distressed at the sorry state of the Palace immediately after the defeat in 1945.

This practice reportedly goes back to a group of volunteers, "Mikuni Hoshidan" (Volunteers for Imperial Japan) who were distressed at the sorry state of the Palace immediately after the defeat in 1945.

This practice reportedly goes back to a group of volunteers, 'Mikuni Hoshidan((Volunteers for Imperial Japan) who were distressed at the sorry state of the Palace immediately after the defeat in 1945.

sen.j: 勤労参加者には、天皇皇后及び皇太子・同妃より会釈を賜る（面会と挨拶伝達）ことができる。
sen.e: The volunteers will be granted bows from the Emperor and Empress as well as the Crown Prince and Princess (a meeting with and greeting to them).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The volunteers will be granted bows from the Emperor and Empress as well as the Crown Prince and Princess (a meeting with and greeting to them).
The volunteers will be granted bows from the Emperor and Empress as well as the Crown Prince and Princess (a meeting with and greeting to them).

sen.j: 以前は恩賜のタバコが授与されたが、現在では菓子が授与されている。
sen.e: In former times they were given imperial cigarettes, now replaced by sweets.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In former times they were given imperial cigarettes, now replaced by sweets.
In former times they were given imperial cigarettes, now replaced by sweets.

tit.e: The Public's Visit to Imperial Palaces
The Public's Visit to Imperial Palaces
The public's visit to Imperial Palaces
tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 宮内庁では、事前の予約に基づき、皇居はじめ京都御所、仙洞御所、桂離宮などの参観を許可している。
sen.e: The public are allowed to visit the Imperial Palaces in Tokyo, Kyoto and Sento, as well as the Katsura Imperial Villa and other establishments if they make advance reservations with the Imperial Household Agency.

The public are allowed to visit the Imperial Palaces in Tokyo, Kyoto and Sento, as well as the Katsura Imperial Villa and other establishments if they make advance reservations with the Imperial Household Agency.
